judgement.reason: A cation is a positively charged ion, whereas a radical cation is a cation that also contains an unpaired electron. Not all cations are radical cations.

A free radical is an atom or molecule with an unpaired electron, while a radical cation is a positively charged ion with an unpaired electron. Not all free radicals are radical cations, and not all radical cations are free radicals.

A free radical is an atom or molecule with an unpaired electron, while a radical cation is a positively charged radical. Not all free radicals are cations, and not all radical cations are merely free radicals.
Free radical cation and radical cation are synonyms, both referring to a positively charged ion with an unpaired electron.
Both terms refer to the same chemical species, which is a positively charged ion with an unpaired electron.
